thread.title: Donald Trump aide Kellyanne Conway draws ire for kneeling on White House Oval Office sofa - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Donald Trump aide Kellyanne Conway draws ire for kneeling on White House Oval Office sofa - Yahoo7

author: Afp On February
title: Donald Trump aide Kellyanne Conway draws ire for kneeling on White House Oval Office sofa - Yahoo7
text:
Share Donald Trump aide Kellyanne Conway draws ire for kneeling on White House Oval Office sofa - Yahoo7 A counselor to US President Donald Trump could face disciplinary action after she was pictured kneeling on a White House sofa with her shoes on. Close Calls for Trump adviser resignation over flogging Ivanka's fashion line UP NEXT VIDEO Calls for Trump adviser resignation over flogging Ivanka's fashion line 
The image of Kellyanne Conway sparked a social media fury with the photo taken as President Trump posed with leaders of historically black colleges and universities. 
Many Twitter users were quick to berate Conway, with many calling her body language a sign of "disrespect". Twitter users berated Conway for the way she was sitting in the Oval Office. 
"Conway with her shoes on the couch in Oval Office - consistent with general level of disrespect Trump team has shown," tweeted one user. 
"The new stock photo for 'white privilege,'" wrote another Twitter user, as the image showed Conway surrounded by a large number of standing black people. Close Kellyanne Conway at CPAC: ‘It’s difficult for me to call myself a feminist’ UP NEXT VIDEO Conway says women don't like seeing other women in power positions Kellyanne Conway at CPAC: ‘It’s difficult for me to call myself a feminist’ 
Some drew comparisons to a 2013 photo of former president Barack Obama with his feet up on the desk of the Oval Office. 
"Remember when Republicans used to flip out over Obama Oval Office decorum," posted one Twitter user. 
Conway recently came under fire for plugging the fashion brand of the president's daughter, Ivanka. 
The head of the US Office of Government Ethics urged the White House to investigate Conway after the incident, saying she should face disciplinary action.
